Package sample

Class Add_Appointment_Controller

java.lang.Object
sample.Add_Appointment_Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class Add_Appointment_Controller extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable

Add Appointments Controller

This controller is used to manage the add appointments page. The goal of it is to make sure the user uses the program as intended and can add appointments easily.

2023-05-03

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)

      Initialize

      This method is used to setup the inner workings of the application such as providing the id field with text or handling setup for the date and time pickers.

      Lambda Expressions

      I used lambda expressions in this method to quickly fill out the choice boxes with the id's from the desired fields
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

    • click_cancel

      public void click_cancel(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException

      Click Cancel

      This method is exactly as it seems. It is used to change the root page back to the main menue of the application

    • click_add

      public void click_add(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException

      Click Add

      This method is used to commit an appointment to the database using the input from the user for all the given fields. It also handles error checking for missing fields and handles error checking for the inputted time. It converts the given time to UTC time for the time to be properly inserted into the database.
      Parameters:
      event -
      Throws:
      IOException

    • throw_error_box

      public void throw_error_box()

      Throw Error Box

      This method is used to raise a remade error box and does not take any input.

      Updates

      Future versions of this program could easily cut down on excess code by taking all of the throw error boxes sprinkled throughout the code and condensing it into its own class for future use.

    • throw_error_box_input

      public void throw_error_box_input(String message)

      Throw Error Box Input

      This throw error box does take input for custom messages. It takes in a string and will use that string as its message to display.
      Parameters:
      message -
